Universe: Universe is the totality of all space, time, matter, energy, and the physical laws and constants that govern them.
Local Group of Galaxy: Local Group of Galaxy is a collection of over 50 galaxies, including the Milky Way, that are bound together by gravity and located within 10 million light-years of each other.
The Milky Way: The Milky Way is a spiral galaxy containing our Solar System, estimated to contain between 200 and 400 billion stars.
Diffuse nebula: A diffuse nebula is an interstellar cloud of dust, hydrogen, helium and other ionized gases that is illuminated by the radiation from nearby stars.
Solar System: The Solar System is a collection of eight planets, their moons, and other celestial bodies that orbit around the Sun.
The Sun: The Sun is a star at the center of our solar system that provides light and heat to the planets in the form of radiation.
Jupiter: Jupiter is the fifth and largest planet in the Solar System, composed mostly of gas and dust.
Saturn: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second largest in the Solar System, known for its iconic rings.
Uranus: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun and the third largest in the Solar System, known for its blue-green color and its tilted axis.
Neptune: Neptune is the eighth and farthest known planet from the Sun in the Solar System.
The Earth: The Earth is a terrestrial planet in the Solar System that is the only known planet to support life.
Venus: Venus is the second planet from the Sun and is the second brightest object in the night sky, after the Moon.
Mars: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and the second-smallest planet in the Solar System, known for its red-orange hue and potential for human exploration.
Mercury: Mercury is the smallest and innermost planet in the Solar System, and is known for its short year and extreme temperatures.
The Moon: The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite, orbiting our planet at an average distance of 238,855 miles.
Mount Everest: Mount Everest is the highest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters (29,029 feet) above sea level.
Mount Fuji: Mount Fuji is a dormant volcano located on the island of Honshu in Japan, and is the country's highest peak at 3,776 meters (12,389 feet).
Angel Falls: Angel Falls is the world's highest uninterrupted waterfall, located in Venezuela, with a total height of 3,212 feet (979 meters).
Ayers Rock: Ayers Rock, also known as Uluru, is a large sandstone rock formation in the Northern Territory of Australia.
Burj Khalifa: Burj Khalifa is the world's tallest building, located in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, standing at 829.8 meters (2,722 feet).
Empire State Building: The Empire State Building is a 102-story Art Deco skyscraper in Midtown Manhattan, New York City, that stands 1,454 feet tall.
Cologne Cathedral: Cologne Cathedral is a Gothic Roman Catholic cathedral in Cologne, Germany, and is one of the most visited landmarks in the country.
Pyramid: Pyramid is a web framework for Python that allows developers to quickly create web applications with minimal code.
Ferris wheel: A Ferris wheel is an amusement park ride consisting of a large, rotating wheel with suspended seats for passengers.
Statue of Liberty: The Statue of Liberty is a colossal neoclassical sculpture on Liberty Island in New York Harbor, a universal symbol of freedom and democracy.
Coast Redwood: Coast Redwood is a species of evergreen tree native to the Pacific Coast of North America, known for its tall, straight trunks and deep red-brown bark.
Jumbo jet airplane: A jumbo jet airplane is a large commercial aircraft with two or more engines, designed to carry a large number of passengers over long distances.
Triumphal arch: A Triumphal arch is a monumental structure in the shape of an archway with a single opening, typically built to commemorate a victory or other important event.
Sphinx: Sphinx is a full-text search engine designed to provide fast and relevant full-text search functionality to applications.
Whale: Whale is a web browser based on Chromium that is designed to provide a faster, more secure, and more efficient browsing experience.
Double deck bus: A double deck bus is a type of bus that has two levels of seating, allowing for more passengers to be transported at once.
Giraffe: Giraffe is a long-necked, hoofed mammal native to Africa, known for its distinctive pattern of spots and its long neck and legs.
Elephant: Elephant is a large mammal with a long trunk, large ears, and thick, gray skin.
Ostrich: Ostrich is a large flightless bird native to Africa, known for its long neck and legs and ability to run at high speeds.
Sunflower: Sunflower is an annual flowering plant with bright yellow petals and a dark center, known for its beauty and ability to track the sun's movement across the sky.
Mankind: Mankind is the human race, consisting of all people on Earth regardless of race, gender, or nationality.
Dog: Dog is a domesticated mammal that is often kept as a pet and is known for its loyalty and companionship.
Chimpanzee: Chimpanzees are a species of great ape found in the forests and savannahs of Africa, and are the closest living relatives to humans.
Turtle: Turtle is a Python library used for creating graphics and visualizations, such as shapes, lines, and other images.
Rabbit: Rabbit is a real-time messaging and collaboration platform that enables users to communicate and collaborate in real-time.
Soccer ball: A soccer ball is a spherical object used in the sport of soccer, typically made of leather or synthetic material and filled with air.
Optical disc (12 cm): Optical disc (12 cm) is a type of storage medium that uses laser technology to store digital data on a flat, circular disc.
Apple: Apple is a multinational technology company that designs, manufactures, and sells consumer electronics, computer software, and online services.
Mouse: Mouse is an input device used to control the movement of a cursor on a computer screen.
SD memory card: An SD memory card is a small, portable storage device used to store digital data such as photos, videos, music, and documents.
Katydid: Katydid is an open-source programming language designed to make it easier to write secure, reliable, and maintainable code.
Coin: Coin is a digital currency that allows users to make secure, anonymous, and fast payments online.
Bee: Bee is a cloud-based project management and collaboration platform that helps teams stay organized and get work done.
Fly: Fly is a cloud-based platform that enables businesses to create, manage, and optimize their digital marketing campaigns.
Ladybird: Ladybird is a small, round, red and black spotted beetle that is commonly found in gardens and fields.
Mosquito: Mosquito is a type of insect that is known for its ability to spread diseases through its bite.
Ant: Ant is a Java-based build tool used to automate software build processes, such as compiling source code, packaging, and running tests.
Water flea: Water flea is a small aquatic crustacean that is commonly used as a model organism in scientific research.
Flea: Flea is a popular flea market app that allows users to buy and sell items locally.
Snow Crystal: Snow Crystal is a snowflake-shaped crystal that is believed to bring good luck and fortune.
Sesame seed: Sesame seed is a small, flat, oval-shaped seed with a nutty flavor that is used in many cuisines around the world.
Tick / mite: Ticks and mites are small arachnids that feed on the blood of animals and humans, often causing irritation and disease.
Ameba: Ameba is a Japanese blogging platform that allows users to create and share content with a community of other users.
Paramecium: Paramecium is a single-celled organism that is commonly found in freshwater ponds and streams.
Ovum: Ovum is an independent technology research and consulting firm that provides insights and advice to help organizations make better decisions about technology investments.
Closterium: Closterium is a genus of unicellular green algae that are found in freshwater and marine environments.
Micro-electromechanical device: A Micro-electromechanical device is a miniature device that combines electrical and mechanical components on a microscopic scale.
Micro-precision optical device: A Micro-precision optical device is a device that uses optics to achieve extremely precise measurements and positioning.
Pollen: Pollen is a fine powdery substance made up of microscopic grains released by plants that is used for fertilization.
Sperm: Sperm is a male reproductive cell that is released during ejaculation and is capable of fertilizing a female egg.
White blood cell: White blood cells are a type of cell in the immune system that help fight infection and disease.
Lymphocyte: Lymphocytes are a type of white blood cell that play an important role in the body's immune system.
Chromosome: A chromosome is a thread-like structure composed of DNA and proteins that carries genetic information and is found in the nucleus of cells.
Red blood cell: Red blood cells are the most common type of blood cell and are responsible for carrying oxygen and carbon dioxide throughout the body.
Lactic acid bacteria: Lactic acid bacteria are a group of bacteria that produce lactic acid as a by-product of their metabolism, which can be used in food production and preservation.
Yeast: Yeast is a single-celled organism that is used in baking and brewing to produce carbon dioxide and alcohol.
Collagen: Collagen is a protein found in the connective tissues of animals, and is the most abundant protein in the human body.
Colibacillus: Colibacillus is a type of bacteria that can cause food poisoning and other illnesses in humans and animals.
Single-electron transistor: A single-electron transistor is a type of transistor that uses a single electron to control the flow of current between two electrodes.
Mitochondria: Mitochondria are organelles found in eukaryotic cells that are responsible for producing energy for the cell through cellular respiration.
Influenza virus: Influenza virus is a contagious virus that causes respiratory illness, including the flu.
AIDS virus: AIDS virus is a retrovirus that attacks the immune system, leading to a weakened state and increased susceptibility to other infections and diseases.
Yellow fever virus: Yellow fever virus is a mosquito-borne virus that can cause severe flu-like symptoms and even death in some cases.
LSI (large scale integrated circuit): LSI (Large Scale Integrated Circuit) is an integrated circuit that contains hundreds to millions of transistors and other components on a single chip.
Protein: Protein is a macronutrient composed of amino acids that is essential for the growth and repair of cells in the body.
Dendrimer: Dendrimers are highly branched, nanoscale polymers with a well-defined structure and multiple functional groups, used in a variety of applications.
Nanoparticles: Nanoparticles are particles with a size of 1-100 nanometers, which can be used for a variety of applications such as drug delivery, sensing, and energy storage.
DNA (Deoxyribonucleic acid): DNA is a molecule that contains the genetic instructions used in the development and functioning of all known living organisms.
Carbon nanotube: Carbon nanotubes are cylindrical molecules composed of carbon atoms that are one nanometer in diameter and have unique properties that make them useful in a variety of applications.
Fullerene: Fullerene is a form of carbon consisting of a hollow cage of atoms in the shape of a soccer ball.
Amino acid: Amino acids are organic molecules that are the building blocks of proteins and are essential for life.
Atom: Atom is a free and open-source text and source code editor for macOS, Linux, and Microsoft Windows with support for plug-ins written in Node.js and embedded Git Control.
Atomic nucleus: Atomic nucleus is the positively charged center of an atom, composed of protons and neutrons.
Neutron: Neutron is an open source software-defined networking (SDN) platform that provides an extensible framework for creating and managing networks in cloud computing environments.
Proton: Proton is an open-source, privacy-focused email service that provides end-to-end encryption for secure communication.
Betelgeuse: Betelgeuse is a red supergiant star located in the constellation Orion, approximately 640 light years from Earth.
Silicon crystal: Silicon crystal is a crystalline form of the chemical element silicon, which is used in the production of semiconductor devices.
